intro: Guatteria brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Marcaceae, which includes species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It produces edible, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or red when ripe. Guatteria brevipedicellata is often found in humid, shaded understories of tropical forests.
